name: tile.draconicevolution:draconiumOre
content: The very basis of Draconic Research

This ore can be found in the overworld bellow y level 8 as well as in the nether at any y level but it is extremely rare in both. You can also find it in much larger quantities in the end in both the main island and in the comets that randomly spawn throughout the end.
Drops 1 - 3 draconium dist when mined. 4 - 12 with fortune 3

name: item.draconicevolution:draconiumDust
content: This is the dust dropped by draconium ore. Can be smelted into draconium ingots.

name: item.draconicevolution:draconiumBlend
content: This item is now depreciated and will be removed in 1.0.2. If you still have some you should smelt it into draconium ingots before you update to 1.0.2

name: item.draconicevolution:draconiumIngot
content: The results of smelting draconium dust in a furnace. Used in most Draconic Evolution recipes.
[c]item.draconicevolution:draconiumIngot:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:draconium
content: A storage block for draconium
[c]tile.draconicevolution:draconium:0
This block is resistant to the wither

name: tile.draconicevolution:draconium
content: Used in the Ritual of Draconic Resurrection and the Ritual of Awakening. Place a draconium block in a charging device and 100 million RF later you have a charged draconium block!
[c]tile.draconicevolution:draconium:2

name: item.draconicevolution:draconicCore
content: Used in most Draconic Evolution recipes
[c]item.draconicevolution:draconicCore:0

name: item.draconicevolution:wyvernCore
content: This is a higher tier core used in higher tier crafting recipes.
[c]item.draconicevolution:wyvernCore:0

name: info.Tool Config GUI
content: This gui is used to configure most Draconic Evolution tools and armor. The default key to open this gui is 'c'

When you open the gui you will see all the items in your inventory. Items that can be configured will be highlighted. When you click on one of the highlighted items you will see a list of settings specific to that item that you can adjust.

You can also use this gui to apply and remove enchantments. In the list of options for the item there is an inventory button. This will open a new gui in which you will have access to your inventory, Enchantment slots on the right and if the item has additional inventory slots such as the obliteration filter for the draconic tools. Those slots will show at the top of the gui.

name: item.draconicevolution:wyvernPickaxe
content: Tiered of your slow old diamond pick? Maby its time to upgrade! Wyvern tools run on RF and never break
All mining tools have an option to adjust mining speed, Dig AOE and AOE safe mode
Dig AOE: Allows you to adjust the mining AOE of the tool. Wyvern AOE: 1x1 and 3x3
AOE Safe mode: If enabled the tool will check for any tile entities in the AOE and if it finds any the tool will not mine
[c]item.draconicevolution:wyvernPickaxe:0

name: item.draconicevolution:wyvernShovel
content: Tiered of your slow old diamond shovel? Maby its time to upgrade! Wyvern tools run on RF and never break
All mining tools have an option to adjust mining speed, Dig AOE and AOE safe mode
Dig AOE: Allows you to adjust the mining AOE of the tool. Wyvern AOE: 1x1 and 3x3
AOE Safe mode: If enabled the tool will check for any tile entities in the AOE and if it finds any the tool will not mine
[c]item.draconicevolution:wyvernShovel:0

name: item.draconicevolution:wyvernSword
content: Ordinary weaponry not good enough anymore? Using draconic knowledge you have found a way to imbue an ordinary diamond sword with the power of Draconium
+20 Attack damage
+10% Mob Health (Adds 10% of the mobs own health to the attack damage)
3x3 AOE Attack
[c]item.draconicevolution:wyvernSword:0

name: item.draconicevolution:wyvernBow
content: Looking for a more powerful bow with some fancy features? This is the one for you. The Wyvern bow has 2 operating modes. Selectable with shift + right click
Rapid Fire: As the name suggests fires arrows at a rather high rate and dose moderate damage.
Sharp Shooter: Allows you to zoom in on your target and deal extremely high damage with pin point accuracy.
Enchantments are twice as effective on this bow.
[c]item.draconicevolution:wyvernBow:0

name: item.draconicevolution:draconiumFluxCapacitor
content: Tired of your tools and armor running out of energy when you need them most, you have figured out how to create an item capable of storing an immense amount of energy and transferring it to your items as they need it.
[c]item.draconicevolution:draconiumFluxCapacitor:0

name: item.draconicevolution:draconiumEnergyCore
content: This component is used in devices that need to be able to store energy
[c]item.draconicevolution:draconiumFluxCapacitor:0

name: item.draconicevolution:wyvernHelm
content: Stronger than diamond you can now withstand even greater blows.
Full set gives total fire immunity
[c]item.draconicevolution:wyvernHelm:0

name: item.draconicevolution:wyvernChest
content: Infusing the armor with Dracomiun you vastly improve its resistance.
Full set gives total fire immunity
[c]item.draconicevolution:wyvernChest:0

name: item.draconicevolution:wyvernLeggs
content: You feel even stronger and faster now that you have infused diamond legs with Draconium.
Full set gives total fire immunity
+Speed boost
[c]item.draconicevolution:wyvernLeggs:0

name: item.draconicevolution:wyvernBoots
content: You learn to improve the boots Draconium seems to have given you greater agility.
Full set gives total fire immunity
+Reduced fall damage
+Jump boost
[c]item.draconicevolution:wyvernBoots:0

name: item.draconicevolution:teleporterMKI
content: You have managed to infuse the powers of The End with your knowledge of the Draconic to create a basic teleporter, but at a cost. The energies binding them are unstable and only last for 10 uses and will take some of your life energy with each use and can only be linked to a single location but works across dimensions. Once used up, you must create a new one.
[c]item.draconicevolution:teleporterMKI:0

name: item.draconicevolution:teleporterMKII
content: Learning how draconic powers interact with the powers of the endermen, you have created the ultimate teleporter. You can now store up to 100 locations and using the endermen’s own pearls as fuel, created something that can teleport you extreme distances even across dimensions at will. Shift right click to open the GUI. Most functionality should be self explanatory. On the left is the destination list. Each destination has a lock button that prevents you from accidentally overwriting or deleting it. On the right starting from the top you have information about the selected destination, An option to rename the selected destination, An option to change the selected destination to your current coordinates and an option to delete the selected destination. Under that is the fuel, An option to teleport to the selected destination, an option to add a new destination (your current location), And an option to add fuel (Ender pearls from your inventory) Shift click to add a stack. You can also shift+Scroll with the item in your hand to cycle through the destinations without opening the gui and right click to teleport. You can also teleport players and mobs by left clicking them however players must be holding shift and mobs can not be teleported across dimensions.
[c]item.draconicevolution:teleporterMKII:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:teleporterStand
content:
You have figured out how to create a simple pedestal on which you can place you basic or advanced charms of dislocation. Simply right click with a charm in your hand to place it on the pedestal then right click the pedestal to teleport. The advantage of this is the charms wont take damage or use fuel. The disadvantage is you can bring them with you to your destination. To remove the charm from the pedestal simply shift right click with an empty hand

When holding basic dislocator that has been renamed in an anvil or an enhanced dislocator with a destination set the name or destination will be displayed above the pedestal. If you hold shift all names will be hidden except the one you are looking at. (Shift behavior can be reversed in the config)
[c]tile.draconicevolution:teleporterStand:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:draconium
content: The key component in the Ritual of Draconic Resurrection.
[c]tile.draconicevolution:draconium:1

name: item.draconicevolution:enderArrow
content: Perhaps not your brightest idea... You found a way to travel even longer distances using ender perls by strapping them to the end of a arrow.
This of course makes the arrow a lot heavier. Too heavy for a regular for a regular bow. Leaving you no choice but to use ether a wyvern or draconic bow.

So what could go wrong you ask? Well as im sure you are aware ender perls on their own are a rather painful way to travel. Now add the power of a wayvern or worse a draconic bow to that and you have a recipe for extreme pain.
Be sure to wear your best fall protection. And just hope its enough
[c]item.draconicevolution:enderArrow.name:0

name: item.draconicevolution:mobSoul
content: You notice that with Draconic Weapons you can now occasionally steal the souls of those things you kill.

name: item.draconicevolution:dragonHeart
content: Dropped by the Ender Dragon and Draconic Dragon. It is your belief that this immensely powerful item may hold the key to unlocking the true power of draconium using an ancient ritual known as the ritual of awakening.
The Ritual:
1.Drop a dragon heart on the ground and activate it with an explosion.

2.Drop 4 to 16 draconic cores on the ground near the activated heart (4 per block of draconium). A few seconds after its initial activation it will draw all nearby items towards it anything that is not a core will be destroyed.
3.Now quickly place 1 to 4 (depending on how many cores you dropped) Charged draconium blocks near the heart.
4.You will know its working when you see the hearts energy targeting the charged draconium blocks. Now stand back and watch the magic happen.
You can only do this ritual once per heart so you best make the most of it.

name: item.draconicevolution:draconicIngot
content: You have been studying the interactions of Draconium with various materials and have come to realize that this is only an inert state.  You have discovered a method to bring out the true power of Draconium using a complex ritual involving a dragon heart. (See the dragon heart page for details)
[c]item.draconicevolution:draconicIngot:0

name: item.draconicevolution:draconicSword
content: Seeking an even more powerful weapon you combine your Wyvern sword with Awakened Draconium to make the ultimate sword
+40 Attack damage

7x7 AOE Attack
[c]item.draconicevolution:draconicSword:0

name: item.draconicevolution:draconicBow
content: Further Draconic research has shown you ways to even greater power.. Sharpshooter – Zoom in on your target and deal extreme damage with pin point accuracy. Rapid Fire – Barrage your enemies in a rain of arrows. Explosive – With gunpowder in your inventory destroy an area slightly larger than TNT with your arrows. Devastation (Creative Mode only) – Explosive + Double rapid fire
[c]item.draconicevolution:draconicBow:0

name: item.draconicevolution:draconicDistructionStaff
content: After great pains you have mastered the powers of the Draconic and created the ultimate weapon and destructive tool!
Mining:
Extreme mining speed
1x1x1 to 9x9x9 AOE with depth independently adjustable
Junk filter
AOE safe mode. To ensure you don't accidental mine your entire base
Attack:
+60 Attack damage
+30% Mob Health (Adds 30% of the mobs own health to the attack damage)
1x1 to 25x25 AOE Attack
[c]item.draconicevolution:draconicDistructionStaff:0

name: item.draconicevolution:draconiumFluxCapacitor
content: With this upgrade you will be able to go for days without needing to stop and recharge.
[c]item.draconicevolution:draconiumFluxCapacitor:1

name: item.draconicevolution:draconicHelm

-Night Vision
-Cures negative potion effects
-Bypass suffocation and drowning damage
-Removes mining slowdown under water (Aqua affinity)
[c]item.draconicevolution:draconicHelm:0

name: item.draconicevolution:draconicChest
content: Using the heart of a dragon you are stronger and have the gift of flight.

-Fire immunity

name: item.draconicevolution:draconicLeggs

name: tile.draconicevolution:weatherController
content: This is a block that allows you to control the weather. To use it place some emeralds in its inventory and select a mode. There are 3 available modes Rain off, Rain on and Thunder storm. To activate apply a redstone signal.
[c]tile.draconicevolution:weatherController:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:generator
content: This is a basic low power (around 80RF/t) generator that may come in handy if you have no other mods capable of generating RF power.
[c]tile.draconicevolution:generator:3

name: tile.draconicevolution:grinder
content: Everyone needs effective mob farms. For the cost of a bit of solid fuel (coal, charcoal, etc.) or RF power, you can kill to your hearts content knowing the forces of the Draconic have your back! The grinder will kill all mobs in a 7x7 area in front of it. It is much more efficient and can kill mobs faster if powered by RF.

To reduce lag xp orbs dropped by the grinder will despawn after 30 seconds if not collected. It is recommended that you use something like the extra utilities vacuum hopper to collect the xp (if available)
[c]tile.draconicevolution:grinder:3

name: tile.draconicevolution:energyInfuser
content: Seeing the need for faster energy transfer you have found a way to bring the infuser to being. Has a faster transfer rate than most other mod’s RF recharge stations (and cool particle effects to boot!)
[c]tile.draconicevolution:energyInfuser:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:sunDial
content: This is an extremely powerful block that allows you to change the time. Simply place it in the world and and apply a constant redstone signal. Once the device charges it will fire a particle beam at the sun accelerating it to 30X its normal speed. Simply shut off the redstone signal when you have the sun where you want it.
[c]tile.draconicevolution:sunDial:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:playerDetector
content: Simple player detection, can be adjusted up to 10 blocks range to detect any players nearby.
[c]tile.draconicevolution:playerDetector:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:playerDetectorAdvanced
content: This is an advanced version of the player detector it has the following features. Max range of 20 blocks. Whitelist/Blacklist for fine tuning who you do or don’t want. Camouflage – Hide your detector so no one sees it. Inverted out put (less redstone needed!).
[c]tile.draconicevolution:playerDetectorAdvanced:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:dissEnchanter
content: With this device you are now able to transfer enchantments from your items to books at the cost of experience. The cost is determined by the repair cost of the item and the repair cost of the item is decreased slightly each time. To use it simply place the enchanted item in the first slot a regular book in the center slot and press the transfer button. One enchantment (the first one) will be stripped from the item and applied to the book. When you strip an enchant the item will loos a percentage of its total durability this percentage is shown in the gui. You can decrease the damage bu placing book shelves around it or other enchanting boosters (It takes a total of 20 book shelves to prevent all damage). WARNING Items that use energy instead of durability will also be damaged and destroyed but will not show their damage value.
[c]tile.draconicevolution:dissEnchanter:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:draconiumChest
content: Using your draconic knowledge you have learned how to create the ultimate chest. With a massive 234 slot storage capacity a built in crafting table and 5 slot RF furnace capable of doubling ore as well as the ability to keep its contents when harvested this chest is the most powerful most versatile storage device in existence! It also comes in a variety of every colour you can imagine gust shift right click it with empty hand for details.
[c]tile.draconicevolution:draconiumChest:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:customSpawner
content: To get started, right click any vanilla spawner with a draconic core to stabilize it. You now have a empty transportable spawner (pick up with draconic tools) Use any mob soul on the spawner to change it to that type.
There are several items you can use to upgrade the spawner:
-Wyvern Core: Upgrades to tier 2 (increases spawn count and speed)
-Awakened Core: Upgrades to tier 3 (further increases spawn count and speed)
-Nether Star: Removes the requirement for a player to be within 16 blocks for the spawner to function.
-Notch Apple: Makes the spawner ignore spawn requirements for the mob it is spawning e.g. Will make monsters spawn even if the light level is to high.
When broken you get back everything except the mob soul (it is to fragile and is destroyed when the spawner is broken)
[c]tile.draconicevolution:customSpawner:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:energyStorageCore
content: Using Draconic knowledge you have discovered how to build a multi-block structure capable of storing more power then any other device ever invented with the highest tier able to store up to 2.14 trillion RF (you can find more info in the Energy core multiblock tutorial)
[c]tile.draconicevolution:energyStorageCore:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:energyPylon
content: This device is used to extract or insert energy into the energy storage multiblock. Its maximum transfer rate is 2,147,483,647 RF/t
[c]tile.draconicevolution:energyPylon:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:particleGenerator
content: Purely decorative, this blocks allows for fully customizable particle effects to be created. For more information check out the instruction manual built into its GUI.
This block is also used as a part of the Energy Core multiblock structure
[c]tile.draconicevolution:particleGenerator:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal
content: This is a the base component of the DE energy net. This device on its own can not send or receive energy from a block. Its purpose is to act as a hub to link devices that can.
See Crystal Binder info for more information on linking and energy distribution
Range:25
Max Connections: 10
[c]tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal
content: This is a more powerful version of the Energy Relay. It is capable of transferring energy much faster and it has the ability to link to a larger number of devices
See Crystal Binder info for more information on linking and energy distribution
Range:50
Max Connections: 20
[c]tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal:1

name: tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal
content: This is the block used to actually import and export energy from the energy net. Simply place it on the side of an energy acceptor or producer and link it to the network. You can change between input and output mode by right clicking it with a crystal binder in "Mode Change" mode
See Crystal Binder info for more information on linking and energy distribution
Range:25
Max Connections: 2
[c]tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal:2

name: tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal
content: This is a more powerful version of the Energy Transceiver. Along with having a much higher energy transfer rate it also has the ability to extract or insert energy into a device 5 times faster then would normally be possible.
See Crystal Binder info for more information on linking and energy distribution
Range:50
Max Connections: 4
[c]tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal:3

name: tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal
content: This device works similar to the Energy Relay except it is also able to wirelessly connect to RF accepting devices
See Crystal Binder info for more information on linking and energy distribution
Range:25
Max Connections: 3
Wireless Range: 15
Max Wireless Connections: 8
[c]tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal:4

name: tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal
content: This is an advanced version of the Wireless Energy Transceiver that is able to connect to a larger number of devices as well as transfer energy at a much higher rate.
See Crystal Binder info for more information on linking and energy distribution
Range:50
Max Connections: 6
Wireless Range: 30
Max Wireless Connections: 16
[c]tile.draconicevolution:energyCrystal:5

name: item.draconicevolution:wrench
content: This is the tool used to link energy devices

Binding: To link two devices switch the tool to bind mode with shift+right click. Then just right click both devices (any order) to link them. Any energy net devices (Relay, Transceiver or Wireless Transceiver) and be linked to one another. The Wireless Transceiver can also be linked to any other RF accepting block by first clicking the transceiver then clicking the block.

Un-Binding: To un bind two linked devices switch the tool to un-bind mode then simply right click the two devices you with to un link. You can also clear all of a devices connections using "un-bind all" mode
Visual Indicator: While holding the Crystal Binder you are able to see the connections between all linked devices (Except the link between wireless transceivers and RF devices)

Connection Limits: All devices support a limited number of connections. This is the number of devices the block can be linked to. Relays have the highest number of available connections and therefor are useful for linking a network of Transceivers which have a very limited number of available connections.

Energy Transfer Mechanic: Each Energy device has its own internal energy buffer. If the buffer of a device it is linked to is lower then its own it will send some energy to that device to try to balance the two buffers. The energy difference between the two buffers is what determines the rate at which energy is sent.
[c]item.draconicevolution:wrench:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:rainSensor
content: A device that emits a redstine signal when it rains. This is perfect for controlling the weather controller.
[c]ile.draconicevolution:rainSensor:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:potentiometer
content: A simple redstone emitter that is capable of emitting a variable strength redstone signal between 0 and 15.
[c]tile.draconicevolution:potentiometer:0

name: tile.draconicevolution:xRayBlock
content: Many of you have probably seen a graphical glitch that sometimes occurs when chunks load that allows you to see through the world and see all of the cave caves and tunnels bellow. This block replicates that effect. When you place it next to another block the face of the block it is touching becomes transparent allowing you to see through the world. This can be very useful for finding cave systems and dungeons maby even things other players don’t want you to find. Such a block dose not come cheap. It will cost you several Nether Stars and it is so fragile that once placed it can not be collected without destroying it. (not even with silk touch)
[c]tile.draconicevolution:xRayBlock:0
TODO

name: item.draconicevolution:safetyMatch
content: Tired of everything burning to the ground when making a fireplace? Use this match to light a fire that will never go out, Will never burn you and will never burn down your house
[c]item.draconicevolution:safetyMatch:1000
Sic of having so many loos matches in your pocket?
[c]item.draconicevolution:safetyMatch:0

name: item.enchanted_book
content: The Reaper enchant increases the drop chance of souls from mobs. It has a max level of 5 and it also makes it possible for regular weapons to drop souls from mobs.

name: info.Energy Storage Multiblock
content: The Energy Core is a multiblock structure that is capable of storing immense amounts of RF power using the energy storage capabilities of Draconium and Redstone.

The Energy Core has 7 Tiers each capable of storing considerably more then the last to build it you will need 5 different components.
 ♦ Energy Core x1
 ♦ Particle Generator x4
 ♦ Redstone Block (number depends on tier)
 ♦ Draconium Block (number depends on tier)
 ♦  Energy Pylon x2+

The Energy core consists of the Energy Core(Block) at the centre surrounded by 4 Particle Generators. The generators must be directly in line with the core as shown in the following images. 
The generators must be placed within 10 blocks of the core.

The Core is then surrounded by a combination of Redstone Blocks and Draconium Blocks the following images show the construction of each tier as well as the material cost and storage capacity. Once the structure is built simply shift right click one of the particle generators (with an empty hand) to activate the core.
§4Tier 1

http://i.imgur.com/BXl1x7e.png[>]http://i.imgur.com/7rtdJV2.png[>]http://i.imgur.com/IagzpKW.png[>]http://i.imgur.com/crmnC6v.png[>]http://i.imgur.com/KSpFook.png[>]http://i.imgur.com/C7WwlAu.png[>]http://i.imgur.com/uC4b8AC.png

Redstone x328
Draconium x218
Capacity = 2.14Trillion RF

To add and remove energy from the core you need to place energy pylons within 15 blocks of the of the core. To activate a pylon place a glass block ether above or below it depending on whether the pylon is placed below or above the core e.g. if you place the pylon on the roof you would place the glass block under it.
http://i.imgur.com/rS9rOoF.png

When the glass block is placed the pylon should immediately activate and link with a nearby Energy Core the link is indicated by white energy particles and the glass should change to the renderer shown in the image above. You can shift right click the pylon to change which core it is linked to (if there is more then one in range)

Energy is added and removed from the core using the Energy Pylons. To toggle a Pylon between input and output mode simply right click the sphere. The mode is identified by the colour of the Pylon (Blue = input, Orange = output) and the behaviour of the energy particles and the Pylon sphere.

Energy Transfer between the pylon and the core is indicated by a stream of blue energy particles flowing between the Pylon sphere and the core. The amount of energy flowing is roughly shown by the density of the particle stream.

The energy stored in the core is displayed by the HUD when you look at it. And in chat when you right click it. The core will also change to a dark red colour as it fills and its energy level can be read by placing a comparator on one of the attached pylons.

name: info.Ritual of Draconic Resurrection
content:
The Ritual of Draconic Resurrection allows you to summon the Ender Dragon. To set it up you will need the following items.

(1) Resurrection Stone
(4) Glowstone Blocks
(4) Obsidian
(4) Diamond Blocks
(4) Charged Draconium Blocks
(12) Quartz Pillars
Setup in the following configuration.
http://i.imgur.com/j2Hm0Am.png

The pillars dont have to be in that exact configuration as long as they are within 5 blocks of the Resurrection Stone. It also looks better if they are symmetrical. The ritual must be setup within 150 blocks of 0,0
Once you have that setup simply right click the Ritual stone and stand back. The ritual should start immediately if it doesn't you have done something wrong.
Right clicking the ritual stone again will stop the ritual and drain the charge from the draconium blocks.

During the ritual all of the Ender Crystals will be re-activated. At the end of the ritual there will be a massive explosion at the centre of the structure that wont do too much damage to the terrain but will kill anything that is standing too close.

The dragon that is spawned by the ritual is almost identical to the original dragon except it has a different texture (By GreatOrator) and it gets harder to kill and deals more damage each time it is summoned (this increase is per player and stops when it reaches a certain difficulty) It also has regeneration for 25 seconds.

name: info.Pigman Blood Rage
content: Don't let the pigmen see you eating pork. You wont like what happens...

name: info.Comets
content: Mined out all of the Draconium ore in the end? Get yourself some form of flight and go search the end. If your lucky you may come across an Ender Comet. These comets are comprised of end stone, obsidian and a significant amount of Draconium ore. By default they have a 1 in 10000 chance to spawn in each chunk so you may need to search for a while and they come in various sizes.
http://i.imgur.com/894RVmP.png

name: info.Chaos Islands
content: Looking for a challenge? the Ender Dragon wasnt hard enough? This is for you! If you travel to any multiple of 10,000 in the end (e.g. {x=0, z=10000}, {x=0, z=20000}, {x=10000, z=0} etc) you will find a Chaos Island. Each of these islands is guarded by a Chaos Guardian which is basically an extremely powerful Ender Dragon that drops 2 dragon hearts and some draconium dust as well as the standard end portal in the middle of the island with a dragon egg on top. Note: The Chaos Island is a work in progress and there will be changes in the future.
http://i.imgur.com/gL4T6dG.png

name: info.Placing items in world
content: Draconic Evolution adds the ability to place any item in the world as a block allowing you to do things like hang tools or other items on walls for display etc. To pla an item in the world simply look at a block with the item selected (as if you were about to place a block) and press the "Place Item" key (p by default) you can place items on the top bottom or sides of a block. You can left click to rotate the item clockwise and shift+left click to rotate the item counter-clockwise you can also shift+right click to rotate the item in very small increments counter-clockwise. Right click to pick the item up.
